module_metadata.title: Discovery Questions Master Guide
module_metadata.purpose: Strategic questions to uncover pain points, qualify leads, and map problems to Zoho solutions

question_frameworks.purpose: Determine if prospect is worth pursuing
question_frameworks.use_when: First conversation, cold call, or initial meeting

questions.question: Tell me about your business - what do you do?
questions.why_ask: Understand industry, business model, identify if it fits any Zoho sweet spots
questions.follow_up_based_on_answer: If they mention selling, follow up with lead management questions. If they mention customers, follow with support questions. If they mention team, ask about collaboration.

questions.question: How many people work in your company?
questions.why_ask: Size determines which solutions and tiers to recommend, pricing expectations
questions.red_flags: Under 5 people with simple needs might not need multiple apps
questions.green_flags: 10+ people with growth plans = good fit for Zoho suite

questions.question: What are your biggest business challenges right now?
questions.why_ask: Open-ended to let them reveal their pain points in their own words

mapping.if_they_say_cash_flow_issues: Books + CRM for better invoicing and payment tracking

questions.question: What tools/software are you currently using to run your business?
questions.why_ask: Understand current tech stack, identify gaps, understand their tech-savviness
questions.follow_up: And how's that working for you? What are you frustrated with?

questions.question: Are you actively looking for a solution, or just exploring?
what_to_listen_for: Boss told me to look = medium priority
questions.qualification: Urgent pain + budget + decision maker = qualified lead to prioritize

question_frameworks.purpose: Uncover sales process pain points that CRM solves
question_frameworks.use_when: Prospect mentions sales, leads, customers, or sales team

questions.question: How do you currently track your leads and customers?
questions.why_ask: Identify if they're using manual methods (prime CRM candidates)
red_flags: Happy with current CRM and no pain points
questions.follow_up: Can I ask - if I called you right now and asked 'show me all leads from last month who haven't been followed up', how long would it take you to pull that up?

questions.question: How many leads do you get per month, and from which sources?
questions.why_ask: Volume determines need urgency; multiple sources = lead chaos
what_to_listen_for: High volume (50+ leads/month) with manual tracking = big pain
Multiple sources (website, ads, referrals, walk-ins) = scattered data
questions.pain_indicator: If they can't answer precisely or have to guess = data visibility problem
questions.solution_pitch: CRM captures all sources automatically and gives you exact numbers in real-time

questions.question: What happens when a lead comes in? Walk me through the process.
questions.why_ask: Identify workflow gaps, manual steps, and drop-off points
pain_indicators: They say: 'Someone from team notes it down'
'We try to call them when we can'
'We have to ask each salesperson what they're working on'
questions.solution_mapping: Every pain point mentioned = CRM feature benefit

questions.question: How do you assign leads to your sales team?
questions.solution_pitch: CRM can auto-assign based on territory, product, lead score, workload - fair and automatic

questions.question: How do you ensure leads are followed up on time?
pain_answers: Excel with reminder dates no one checks
questions.critical_follow_up: What percentage of leads do you think fall through the cracks due to no follow-up?
questions.solution_pitch: CRM automatic reminders, overdue alerts, manager visibility - nothing falls through

questions.question: Can you see your sales pipeline right now - which deals are about to close, which are stuck?
questions.solution_pitch: CRM gives real-time pipeline dashboard - see everything instantly, from anywhere

questions.question: How do you track which marketing source brings your best customers?
questions.solution_pitch: CRM tracks source for every lead and shows conversion rate by source - know exactly where to invest marketing budget

questions.question: What happens when a salesperson leaves? What happens to their leads and customer data?
questions.why_ask: Identify data loss risk and business continuity issue
questions.solution_pitch: CRM = all data stays in company system forever, instantly reassign to another rep

question_frameworks.use_when: Prospect mentions invoicing, accounting, expenses, taxes, or cash flow

questions.question: How do you currently create invoices for your customers?
questions.follow_up: How long does it take to create one invoice?
questions.solution_pitch: Zoho Books: professional invoice in under 60 seconds

questions.question: Can you tell me right now - what's your profit or loss for last month?
pain_answers: Have to wait for CA's report
questions.critical_insight: If they can't answer immediately = no real-time financial visibility
questions.solution_pitch: Books gives real-time P&L dashboard - know your profit anytime, anywhere

questions.question: How do you track which customers haven't paid you?
questions.follow_up: How much money is currently stuck in unpaid invoices?
questions.solution_pitch: Books tracks every invoice status, sends automatic reminders, shows aging report - get paid faster

questions.question: How do you handle GST/VAT filing?
questions.solution_pitch: Books automatically maintains GST-compliant records, generates returns - CA's work cut by 60%

questions.question: How much time does your accountant/CA spend on data entry and organizing receipts?
questions.roi_calculation: If CA spends X hours at Y rate, Books saves Z hours = $$ saved
questions.solution_pitch: Books eliminates 70% of manual data entry - your CA's time becomes strategic, not clerical

questions.question: How long does it take from sending invoice to receiving payment on average?
questions.solution_pitch: Books automatic reminders and payment links reduce average collection time by 30-40%

questions.question: Do you track inventory? How?
questions.why_ask: Identify if they need Books (with basic inventory) or Inventory (advanced)

question_frameworks.use_when: Prospect mentions customer support, complaints, service requests, or support team

questions.question: How do your customers reach you for support? (email, phone, chat, WhatsApp?)
questions.solution_pitch: Zoho Desk consolidates all channels into one organized ticketing system

questions.question: Have customers ever said 'I contacted you but no one responded'?
questions.follow_up: How do you ensure no customer request falls through cracks?
questions.solution_pitch: Desk ensures every request becomes a tracked ticket - nothing gets lost

questions.question: If two agents accidentally respond to the same customer, would you know?
questions.solution_pitch: Desk shows exactly who's working on what - zero duplication

questions.question: Can you tell me right now - how many support tickets are pending, and for how long?
questions.solution_pitch: Desk dashboard shows everything - pending count, average resolution time, SLA breaches - real-time

questions.question: How do you measure your support team's performance?
questions.solution_pitch: Desk tracks response time, resolution time, CSAT scores, agent performance - data-driven management

questions.question: Do you have a knowledge base where customers can find answers themselves?
questions.solution_pitch: Desk includes knowledge base - reduce repetitive questions by 30-40%, customers get instant answers

question_frameworks.use_when: Prospect mentions projects, deadlines, team coordination, or client deliverables

questions.question: How do you currently track project tasks and deadlines?
questions.solution_pitch: Zoho Projects - organized task management with dependencies, Gantt charts, and automatic reminders

questions.question: How often do projects miss deadlines?
questions.critical_follow_up: What's the main reason for delays?

questions.question: If I ask 'what should your team work on today', how would they know?
questions.why_ask: Test for clarity and priority communication
questions.solution_pitch: Projects shows each team member their tasks, priorities, and deadlines - no confusion

questions.question: How do you track time spent on projects or clients?
questions.solution_pitch: Projects includes timesheet tracking - accurate billing, profitability visibility

questions.question: When clients ask for project status updates, how long does it take you to compile the information?
questions.solution_pitch: Projects client portal - clients see real-time status themselves, reduces your update meetings

the_pain_before_solution_framework.description: Don't pitch features. Uncover pain first, then show how Zoho solves it.
steps: 1. Ask open-ended question about their process
2. Listen for pain points (manual work, delays, errors, lack of visibility)
3. Quantify the pain: 'How much time does that take?' or 'How often does that happen?'
4. Let them feel the pain: 'That must be frustrating' or 'What's that costing you?'
5. ONLY THEN pitch the solution specifically to THEIR pain
the_pain_before_solution_framework.example: Instead of: 'Zoho CRM has automatic lead assignment.' Say: 'You mentioned leads sometimes sit for days before anyone contacts them. How many leads do you think you lose that way per month? [They answer] That's painful. If you could automatically assign leads to the right salesperson within 5 minutes of them inquiring, would that solve this problem? [Yes] That's exactly what Zoho CRM does.'

the_comparison_close.description: Help them see the cost of NOT changing
the_comparison_close.framework: You're currently spending $X (time/money/lost opportunity) on this problem. Our solution costs $Y. You save $Z. Makes sense?
the_comparison_close.example: You said manual invoicing takes your team 15 hours per month, and you're still collecting payments slowly. That's roughly $400 in wasted time plus lost interest on delayed payments. Zoho Books costs $40/month and cuts that to under 2 hours plus gets you paid 15 days faster. You're ahead $350+ per month immediately. Sound fair?

red_flags_to_disqualify: No budget and no pain (just browsing)
Not the decision maker and won't introduce you to one
Just signed long-term contract with competitor
Business too small for the investment (1-2 person company with $5K annual revenue)
Looking for industry-specific solution Zoho doesn't offer
green_flags_to_prioritize: Urgent pain actively looking for solution
Budget allocated or clear ROI understanding
Growth company (current solution breaking down under scale)
Multiple pain points across different departments (upsell opportunity)
Already using one Zoho app and happy (expansion opportunity)
